text: The word of the Lord, which came to Joel, son of Pethuel.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Hear this, elders,
    and give ear, all inhabitants of the land!
Has anything like this happened in your days,
    or in the days of your fathers?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Tell it to your children,
    and let your children tell their children,
    and let their children tell another generation.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Awaken, drunkards, and weep!
    Wail, all wine-drinkers,
because the sweet wine
    has been cut off from your lips.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For a nation powerful and innumerable
    has invaded my land;
its teeth are like the teeth of a lion,
    like the fangs of a lioness.
speaker: Narrator

text:
It has despoiled my vine,
    and splintered my fig tree;
it has stripped off its bark
    and cast it away,
    leaving its branches white.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Lament like a virgin wearing sackcloth
    for the husband of her youth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The grain offering and the drink offering
    are cut off from the house of the Lord;
the priests mourn, who are
    ministers to the Lord.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text:
Put on sackcloth and lament, O priests;
    wail, ministers of the altar.
Come, spend the night in sackcloth,
    ministers of my God,
because the grain offering and the drink offering
    are withheld from the house of your God.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Consecrate a fast,
    call a sacred assembly,
assemble the elders
    and all the inhabitants of the land
to the house of the Lord your God,
    and cry out to the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Alas, for the day!
    For the day of the Lord is near,
    and like devastation from the Almighty it comes.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Has not the food been cut off
    before our eyes,
joy and gladness
    from the house of our God?
speaker: Narrator

text:
The seeds have shriveled
    under their shovels,
the storehouses have been deserted;
    the granaries have been torn down,
    because the grain has dried up.
speaker: Narrator

text:
How the beasts groan!
    The herds of cattle are confused,
because they have no pasture;
    even the flocks of sheep suffer.
speaker: Narrator

text:
To You, O Lord, I call,
    because fire has devoured the wild pastures,
    and flame has burned all the trees of the field.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Even the beasts of the field long for You,
    because the streams of water have dried up,
    and fire has devoured the wild pastures.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Blow the ram’s horn in Zion,
    sound the alarm on My holy mountain! 
All the inhabitants of the earth will tremble,
    because the day of the Lord has come,
because it is near—
speaker: Narrator

text:
a day of darkness and gloom,
    a day of clouds and thick darkness.
Like blackness spreading over the mountain,
    a great and mighty army comes,
such as was never before,
    and will never be again,
    even through the years of all generations.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Before them fire devours,
    and behind them a flame blazes;
the land is like the garden of Eden before them,
    but behind them a desolate wasteland,
    and nothing escapes them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They have the appearance of horses,
    and like cavalry they run.
speaker: Narrator

text:
As with the sound of chariots,
    they leap on the mountaintops,
as with the sound of a flame of fire consuming stubble,
    as a mighty army arrayed for war.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Before them, peoples are tormented;
    every face turns pale.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Like mighty men they run,
    like men of war they scale a wall;
each marches on his way,
    they do not swerve from their paths.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
They rush on the city,
    they run on the wall;
they climb up into the houses,
    they enter through the windows like thieves.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Before them the earth quakes,
    the heavens shake;
the sun and moon darken,
    and the stars withdraw their radiance.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord has sounded His voice
    before His army,
for His camp is exceedingly great;
    mighty is the one who accomplishes His word.
For great is the day of the Lord,
    and very awe-inspiring.
    Who can endure it?
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text:
Who knows? He might turn aside and relent,
    and He might leave behind a blessing—
a grain offering and a food offering
    for the Lord your God.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Blow the ram’s horn in Zion,
    consecrate a fast,
    call a sacred assembly.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Gather the people,
    consecrate the congregation,
assemble the elders,
    gather the children
    and those nursing at the breast;
let the bridegroom leave his room
    and the bride her chamber.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Between the temple porch and the altar,
    let the priests, ministers of the Lord, weep and say,
“Have pity upon Your people,
    and do not make Your heritage a disgrace,
    a mockery among the nations.
Why should they say among the peoples,
    ‘Where is their God?’ ”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then the Lord became jealous for His land
    and took pity upon His people.
speaker: Narrator

text:
So the Lord answered and said to His people,
Here! I am sending you grain, new wine, and oil,
    and you will be satisfied,
and I will never again make you
    a disgrace among the nations.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will remove the northerner far from you,
    and I will banish him to a dry and desolate land,
those in front to the eastern sea,
    and those in back to the western sea,
and his stink will rise,
    and his stench will rise,
    for he has done great things.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Do not be afraid, beasts of the field,
    because the wild pastures flourish,
because the tree bears its fruit;
    the fig tree and the vine yield their abundance.
speaker: Narrator

text:
And children of Zion, exult
    and rejoice in the Lord your God,
because He has given to you
    the early rain for vindication.
He showers down rains for you,
    the early rain and the latter rain, as before.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then the threshing floors will be filled with grain,
    and the vats will overflow with new wine and oil.
speaker: Narrator

text:
And I will compensate you for the years the locusts have eaten—
    the larval locust, the hopper locust,
    and the fledging locust—
My great army which I sent against you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You will eat abundantly and be satisfied,
    and you will praise the name of the Lord your God,
    who has worked wonders for you;
and My people will never again be shamed.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then you will know that I am in the midst of Israel,
    that I am the Lord your God,
    and that there is no other.
And My people will never again be shamed.
speaker: Narrator

text:
And it will be that, afterwards,
    I will pour out My Spirit on all flesh;
then your sons and your daughters will prophesy,
    your old men will dream dreams,
    and your young men will see visions.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Even on the menservants and maidservants
    in those days I will pour out My Spirit.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then I will work wonders in the heavens
    and the earth—
    blood and fire and columns of smoke.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The sun will be turned to darkness,
    and the moon to blood,
    before the great and awe-inspiring day of the Lord comes.
speaker: Narrator

text:
And it will be that everyone
    who calls on the name of the Lord will be saved.
For on Mount Zion and in Jerusalem
    there will be deliverance,
    as the Lord has said,
and among the survivors
    whom the Lord calls.
speaker: Narrator

text:
In those days and at that time,
    when I restore the fortunes of Judah and Jerusalem,
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will gather all the nations,
    and bring them down to the Valley of Jehoshaphat.
I will enter into judgment with them there
    regarding My people and My heritage Israel,
whom they have scattered among the nations;
    they have also divided up My land.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They have cast lots for My people,
    and have traded a boy for a prostitute;
they have sold a girl for wine,
    that they might drink.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also, what are you to Me, Tyre and Sidon and all the regions of Philistia? Are you repaying Me for something? If you are repaying Me, I will return your payment swiftly and speedily on your head.
speaker: Narrator

text: For you have taken My silver and My gold, and you have carried off My finest treasures to your temples.
speaker: Narrator

text: You have sold the people of Judah and Jerusalem to the Greeks in order to remove them far from their border.
speaker: Narrator

text: I am about to rouse them from the place to which you have sold them, and I will return your payment on your head.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will sell your sons and your daughters into the hand of the people of Judah, and they will sell them to the Sabeans—to a distant nation, for the Lord has spoken.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Proclaim this among the nations:
    Consecrate a war!
Stir up the mighty men!
    Let all the men of war draw near and rise.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Hurry and come, all you surrounding nations,
    and gather there. 
Bring down Your warriors, O Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let the nations be roused,
    and go up to the Valley of Jehoshaphat;
for there I will sit
    to judge all the surrounding nations.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Swing the sickle,
    for the harvest is ripe.
Come and tread,
    for the winepress is full.
    The wine vats overflow,
because their evil is great.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Multitudes, multitudes,
    in the valley of decision!
For the day of the Lord is near
    in the valley of the decision.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The sun and moon darken,
    and the stars withdraw their radiance.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord roars from Zion,
    and sounds His voice from Jerusalem,
    and heaven and earth quake.
But the Lord is a refuge for His people,
    and a stronghold for the children of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then you will know that I am the Lord your God,
    who dwells in Zion, My holy mountain.
And Jerusalem will be holy,
    and invaders will never again pass through her.
speaker: Narrator

text:
And it will be that in that day the mountains will drip sweet wine,
    and the hills will flow with milk,
    and all the streambeds of Judah will flow with water;
a spring will proceed from the house of the Lord
    and will water the Valley of Shittim.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Egypt will become a desolation,
    and Edom a desolate wasteland,
because of the violence done to the people of Judah—
    they shed innocent blood in their land.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But Judah will be inhabited forever,
    and Jerusalem for generations and generations.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will avenge their blood,
    which I have not yet avenged.
The Lord dwells in Zion!
speaker: Narrator
